intro: Hoplophytum dealbatum, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features a basal rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves that help it store water in its native arid environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive central disk. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
